title: Texas A&M History Timeline
subtitle: Explore key moments in Aggie history

events.title: Morrill Land Grant Act Passed
events.description: The Morrill Land Grant Act is passed establishing a system of land-grant colleges in the United States.

events.title: Texas Accepts Morrill Act
events.description: The Texas Legislature accepts the provision of the Morrill Land Grant Act.

events.title: Texas A&M College Established
events.description: The Texas Legislature establishes the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas.

events.title: Building Funds Approved
events.description: The Texas Legislature approves $75,000 for the construction of college buildings.

events.title: Brazos County Selected as Campus Site
events.description: Brazos County is selected as the site of the college, which will be situated on 2,416 acres donated by citizens of the county

events.title: Land Grant Revenue Generated
events.description: Texas receives 180,000 acres of land under the Morrill Act. The land is sold at 75 cents per acre and proceeds invested in 7% gold frontier defense bonds yielding $174,000.

events.title: Board of Directors Established
events.description: The Texas Legislature passes an act that establishes the Board of Directors as the governing body of the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas.

events.title: First Board Meeting Held
events.description: The Board of Directors hold their first meeting in Bryan, Texas, with Governor Richard Coke serving as ex-officio chairman.

events.title: First President and Faculty Appointed
events.description: Thomas S. Gathright named president of AMC and the first faculty members are appointed.

events.title: College Opens
events.description: Formal opening ceremonies are held and students begin classes at AMC.

events.title: First Commencement Ceremony
events.description: The College holds its first commencement ceremony

events.title: College Station Post Office Established
events.description: The first College Station Post Office is established near the train depot.

events.title: Crisp Affair
events.description: The 'Crisp Affair' leads to the dismissal of the entire faculty, including the president.

events.title: John Garland James Named President
events.description: John Garland James is appointed President of the College. The faculty is reorganized and the curricula are reduced to 3 years.

events.title: First Graduates
events.description: The first students graduate from the College.

events.title: President Position Abolished
events.description: Hardaway Hunt Dinwiddie appointed Chairman of the Faculty. The office of President is abolished.

events.title: Four-Year Curriculum Adopted
events.description: The Board of Directors abolishes preparatory classes and adopts the four year curriculum.

events.title: Hatch Act Passed
events.description: Congress passes the Hatch Act, which establishes agricultural experiment stations in several states.

events.title: Scott Volunteers Established
events.description: The Scott Volunteers is established, which would later become the Ross Volunteers.

events.title: Texas Agricultural Experiment Station Created
events.description: The Texas Agricultural Experiment Station is established as a Division of the College, under the provisions of the Hatch Act.

events.title: Louis L. McInnis Appointed Chairman
events.description: Louis L. McInnis appointed as Chairman of the Faculty.

events.title: First San Jacinto Day Celebration
events.description: The first known celebration of San Jacinto Day at Texas A&M occurs on April 21, 1889 with a field day for cadets. This celebration would eventually be associated with Muster.

events.title: Earliest Known Aggie Ring
events.description: Earliest known Aggie Ring.

events.title: Chairman Position Abolished
events.description: The position of Chairman of the Faculty is abolished.

events.title: Lawrence Sullivan Ross Named President
events.description: Lawrence Sullivan Ross is appointed president of the college. He would begin serving on February 1, 1891.

events.title: Century Tree Planted
events.description: Estimated planting of the Century Tree.

events.title: Battalion First Published
events.description: The first issue of the Battalion is published. It contains the first use of the word "fish" to refer to freshman.

events.title: Aggie Band Founded
events.description: The Aggie Band is established.

events.title: First Football Game
events.description: First Aggie football game is played.

events.title: First Yearbook Published
events.description: The first yearbook is published as the 'Olio.'

events.title: Graduating Dress Parade Begins
events.description: The Graduating Dress Parade is held immediately after the graduation ceremony. This tradition would later become known as Final Review.

events.title: L. L. Foster Named President
events.description: L. L. Foster is appointed president of the College.
events.imageAlt: Snippet from the Battalion on the Hiring of L. L. Foster

events.title: YMCA Founded
events.description: The opening meeting for the YMCA is held in the Assembly Hall.
events.imageAlt: A portion of the article about the opening meeting for the YMCA

events.title: First Summer Session
events.description: First summer session is held; no further summer sessions are held until 1909.

events.title: First Bonfire
events.description: The first known bonfire celebrating the Texas A&M and University of Texas football game is held in Bryan.

events.title: David F. Houston Named President
events.description: David F. Houston is appointed president of the College.

events.title: Muster Tradition Begins
events.description: Muster begins on April 21, 1903.

events.title: Longhorn Yearbook First Published
events.description: The first Longhorn published, which will become the annual yearbook.

events.title: Kyle Field Established
events.description: An athletic field is established by the College and called 'Kyle Field' by students to recognize Professor E. J. Kyle's involvement in establishing it. The Board of Director's officially names the athletic field 'Kyle Field' in 1956.

events.title: H. H. Harrington Named President
events.description: H. H. Harrington is appointed president of the College.

events.title: Yell Leaders First Mentioned
events.description: Yell Leaders are first mentioned in the Battalion in 1906. The first recorded Yell Leader is Tom Armstrong Adams in the 1908 Longhorn.

events.title: Robert Teague Milner Named President
events.description: Robert Teague Milner is appointed president.

events.title: First March to the Brazos
events.description: The first known March to the Brazos occurred. At this time, the March to the Brazos was known as the 'Hike'.

events.title: School of Agriculture Created
events.description: The School of Agriculture is established.

events.title: School of Engineering Created
events.description: The School of Engineering is established.

events.title: First Yell Practice
events.description: The first known Yell Practice is held.

events.title: Charles Puryear Named Acting President
events.description: Charles Puryear is appointed acting president.

events.title: William Bennet Bizzell Named President
events.description: William Bennet Bizzell is appointed president.

events.title: Texas Engineering Experiment Station Organized
events.description: The Texas Engineering Experiment Station is organized.

events.title: State Forester Office Created
events.description: Texas legislature passes an act creating the office of State Forester. Jurisdiction over the state forestry activities is given to the Board of Directors of the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas.

events.title: Agricultural Extension Service Established
events.description: Following the passing of the Smith-Lever Act in 1914, the Agricultural Extension Service becomes a division of the College in 1915.

events.title: First Use of "Gig 'em" in Print
events.description: Earliest found use of “Gig ‘em” as part of the “Spell Yell” published in the 1915 yell book

events.title: School of Veterinary Medicine Founded
events.description: The School of Veterinary Medicine is established

events.title: Junior Branches Established
events.description: John Tarleton Agricultural College (Stephenville) and North Texas Agricultural College (Arlington) are established as Junior branches of the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas.

events.title: Silver Taps First Mentioned
events.description: The first mention of Silver Taps in the Battalion is in 1918, in regards to a death of a cadet.

events.title: Aggie War Hymn Written
events.description: J. V. 'Pinky' Wilson writes the Aggie War Hymn during WWI.

events.title: First Radio Broadcast of Football Game
events.description: First play-by-play of a college football game is broadcast over the radio by cadets.

events.title: Senior Boots Officially Adopted
events.description: Senior boots officially established as apart of the uniform in 1920.

events.title: 12th Man Tradition Begins
events.description: E. King Gill begins the tradition of the 12th man during the post-season Dixie Classic football game.

events.title: Gig 'em' First Appears in Battalion
events.description: First appearance of the phrase "Gig 'em" in the Battalion.

events.title: School of Vocational Teaching Founded
events.description: The School of Vocational Teaching is established

events.title: Aggie Orchestra Officially Recognized
events.description: The Aggie Orchestra was officially recognized in 1924. Before that, any orchestra performers were pulled from the College Band to play at events.

events.title: School of Arts and Sciences Created
events.description: The School of Arts and Sciences is established.

events.title: Graduate School Founded
events.description: The Graduate School is established and graduate programs begin.

events.title: Thomas Otto Walton Named President
events.description: Thomas Otto Walton is appointed president.

events.title: Elephant Walk Tradition Started
events.description: Elephant Walk is started by class of 1926. As freshman, the class of '26 paraded around campus after football games, and resurrected this walk during the football season of their senior year, holding the first Elephant Walk in 1925.

events.title: Spirit of Aggieland' Introduced
events.description: The 'Spirit of Aggieland' is introduced.

events.title: Texas Forest Service Organized
events.description: Activities of the State Forester are organized into the Texas Forest Service and made a major division of the College.

events.title: Midnight Yell Practice First Referenced
events.description: Earliest found reference to Midnight Yell Practice in the 1932 Longhorn, referencing the 1931 football season.

events.title: Reveille I First Public Appearance
events.description: Reveille I appeared in front of a crowd for the first time at the TCU game in 1932.

events.title: Enrollment Limited to Men Only
events.description: The Board of Directors limited enrollment at the College to men only.

events.title: Aggie Ring Design Standardized
events.description: The Aggie Ring design is standardized in 1934. The class of 1894 is credited with initiating the class ring.

events.title: AAU Recognition Received
events.description: The association of American Universities recognizes the College.

events.title: First Ring Dance
events.description: The first Ring Dance is held.

events.title: Singing Cadets Officially Established
events.description: The Singing Cadets is officially established in 1940, with roots in Glee Club dating back to 1893.

events.title: Corregidor Muster
events.description: Muster occurs on Corregidor Island during World War II.

events.title: First Aggie Medal of Honor Recipient
events.description: Lloyd H. Hughes becomes the first Aggie recipient of the Medal of Honor.

events.title: Gibb Gilchrist Named President
events.description: Gibb Gilchrist is appointed president.

events.title: Rangers at Pointe du Hoc
events.description: Lieutenant Colonel James Earl Rudder leads the 2nd Ranger Battalion of the 83rd Division up a 100 foot cliff at Pointe du Hoc on D-Day.

events.title: Research Foundation Established
events.description: The Texas A&M Research Foundation is established.

events.title: A&M University System Created
events.description: The Texas A&M University System is established by the Board of Directors. Gibb Gilchrist is named Chancellor. The System included North Texas Agricultural College, Tarleton Agricultural College, Prairie View College, Texas Agricultural Experiment Stations, and Texas Agricultural Extension Services.

events.title: Texas Engineering Extension Service Founded
events.description: The Texas Engineering Extension Service is established.

events.title: Frank C. Bolton Named President
events.description: Frank C. Bolton is appointed president.

events.title: Marion T. Harrington Named President
events.description: Marion T. Harrington is appointed president.

events.title: Ross Volunteers Escort Governor
events.description: The Ross Volunteers escort Governor Alan Shiver into Kyle Field.

events.title: President Harrington Inaugurated
events.description: President Marion T. Harrington is inaugurated at Kyle Field.

events.title: Liberty Bell Replica Presented
events.description: The Texas' Liberty Bell Replica is presented to Texas A&M College.

events.title: Memorial Student Center Dedicated
events.description: The Memorial Student Center is formally dedicated.

events.title: Reveille II Becomes Mascot
events.description: Reveille II becomes new mascot. She begins living with the Quartermaster Corps and student Sam Netterville becomes her caretaker.

events.title: Aggie Honor Code Adopted
events.description: Aggie Honor Code begins to be adopted on campus on a limited basis. Professors and students had to decide unanimously to enforce the Honor Code for the duration of a given course.

events.title: Harrington Named Chancellor
events.description: Marion T. Harrington '22 is appointed Chancellor of the A&M System. David Hitchens Morgan is appointed President of the College.

events.title: Corps Membership Made Optional
events.description: The Board of Directors decides that Corps of Cadets membership will be optional.

events.title: Fish Camp Begins
events.description: Fish Camp program is held for the first time for incoming freshman. This program was initiated by YMCA Director J. Gordan Gay.

events.title: First Bonfire Fatality
events.description: The first Bonfire related death occurred. A student was killed at the bonfire guard due to a vehicle accident.

events.title: John David Crow Wins Heisman
events.description: John David Crow wins the Heisman Trophy.

events.title: Harrington Named President and System Head
events.description: Marion T. Harrington '22 is appointed President of the College and the A&M System.

events.title: Two Years of Corps Required
events.description: The Board of Directors makes the decision that membership in the Cadet Corps is required for the first two years at A&M College.

events.title: James Earl Rudder Named President
events.description: James Earl Rudder ’32 named President of Texas A&M.

events.title: E-2 Company Takes Over Reveille Care
events.description: E-2 Company is formed to take over care of Reveille, replacing the 'A' Quartermaster

events.title: Harrington Named System Chancellor
events.description: Marion T. Harrington ’22 appointed Chancellor of the A&M System.

events.title: Bryan Air Force Base Acquired
events.description: The Bryan Air Force Base is deeded to A&M, which operated as the Texas A&M Research and Extension Center before being dedicated as the Riverside Campus, and later RELLIS Campus.

events.title: Women and African Americans Begin Enrolling
events.description: Women and African American students begin enrolling at Texas A&M University on a limited basis.

events.title: Renamed Texas A&M University
events.description: Texas Legislature renamed Texas A&M College to Texas A&M University.

events.title: Corps Membership Made Fully Optional
events.description: The Board of Directors decides that the Cadet Corps membership is optional.

events.title: Liberal Arts, Science, and Geosciences Colleges Created
events.description: The College of Liberal Arts, College of Science and College of Geosciences are established.

events.title: Rudder Named System and University President
events.description: The Office of Chancellor abolished. James Earl Rudder '32 appointed President of Texas A&M System and assumed duties as President of the University.

events.title: Reveille III Becomes First Lady
events.description: Reveille III becomes First Lady of Aggieland after Reveille II retires.

events.title: Galveston Campus Dedicated
events.description: The Mitchell Campus at Galveston is dedicated.

events.title: College of Business Administration Founded
events.description: The College of Business Administration is established.

events.title: Record Bonfire Height
events.description: Texas A&M momentarily broke the Guiness Record for world's tallest Bonfire in 1969, with a bonfire of 107 feet and 10 inches.

events.title: Education and Architecture Colleges Created
events.description: The College of Education and the College of Architecture and Environmental Design are established.

events.title: Jack K. Williams Named President
events.description: Jack K. Williams '34 is appointed President

events.title: Naval ROTC Program Established
events.description: The Naval ROTC program is established at Texas A&M University, making the Corps of Cadets open to all branches of military service.

events.title: Campus Housing Opened to Women
events.description: Campus housing is opened to women.

events.title: Women's Athletics Program Founded
events.description: The Women's Athletics program is established.

events.title: Women Admitted to Corps
events.description: Texas A&M Corps of Cadets begins admitting women into the Corps.

events.title: Centennial Wood Carvings Unveiled
events.description: Six A&M Centennial wood carvings by Sue and Rodney Hill are unveiled in the Memorial Student Center.

events.title: KAMU-FM Goes on Air
events.description: KAMU-FM went on the air.

events.title: Williams Named Chancellor and Acting President
events.description: Jack K. Williams ’34 is appointed Chancellor of the A&M System and Acting President of the University.

events.title: Jarvis E. Miller Named President
events.description: Jarvis E. Miller ’50 is appointed President.

events.title: College of Medicine Begins
events.description: The College of Medicine begins with a class of 32 students.

events.title: Silver Taps Ceremony Standardized
events.description: The Student Senate passes a bill changing Silver Taps ceremony to be help on the first Tuesday of every month at 10:30 PM.

events.title: Galveston Campus Renamed
events.description: Texas Legislature renames Moody College to Texas A&M University at Galveston.

events.title: First Medical School Graduates
events.description: The first Texas A&M College of Medicine class graduates.

events.title: Frank E. Vandiver Named President
events.description: Frank E. Vandiver is appointed President.

events.title: First Faculty Senate Speaker
events.description: Dr. John McDermott named the first Senate Speaker for the Faculty Senate.

events.title: The Big Event Created
events.description: Texas A&M Student Government creates 'The Big Event,' a service project benefitting the Bryan College Station community.

events.title: Spirit of '02 Cannon First Fired
events.description: The Spirit of '02 cannon is first fired in 1982. The cannon begins being regularly used at games starting in 1984.

events.title: Reveille V Becomes First Lady
events.description: Reveille V becomes First Lady of Aggieland following Reveille IV's retirement.

events.title: First Aggie in Space
events.description: William Pailes becomes the first Aggie in space.

events.title: Corps Special Units Opened to Women
events.description: Special units in the Corps and the Aggie Band are opened to women following a class-action lawsuit.

events.title: TAMU.edu Domain Registered
events.description: The internet domain 'tamu.edu' is registered.

events.title: T-Camp Established
events.description: T-Camp for transfer students is established.

events.title: William H. Mobley Named President
events.description: William H. Mobley is appointed President.

events.title: System Expansion
events.description: Chorpus Christi State University, Texas A&I University, and Laredo State University merge into the Texas A&M University System. The schools are renamed Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi, Texas A&M Kingsville, and Texas A&M International University, respectively.

events.title: Japan Campus Opens
events.description: Texas A&M University campus opens in Koriyama, Japan.

events.title: Italy Study Center Opens
events.description: Texas A&M University opens the Santa Chiara Study Center in Castiglioni Fiorentino, Italy.

events.title: West Texas State Joins System
events.description: West Texas State University joins the Texas A&M University System and is renamed West Texas A&M University.

events.title: Female-Only Corps Units Disbanded
events.description: Female only Corps units are disbanded.

events.title: Mexico City Center Opens
events.description: Texas A&M University opens a center in Mexico City.

events.title: Bush Library Site Selected
events.description: Texas A&M selected as the site for the George Bush Presidential Library and Museum.

events.title: Reveille VI Becomes First Lady
events.description: Reveille VI becomes First Lady after Reveille V retired.

events.title: Reveille VI Kidnapped
events.description: Reveille VI is kidnapped and later returned unharmed.

events.title: Corps Hall of Honor Established
events.description: Corps of Cadets Hall of Honor is established.

events.title: Big Eight Conference Invitation Accepted
events.description: Texas A&M Board of Regents votes to accept the invitation to join the Big Eight Conference.

events.title: Ray M. Bowen Named President
events.description: Ray M. Bowen '58 is appointed President.

events.title: I-Camp Established
events.description: I-Camp is established for newly enrolled international students.

events.title: Olympic Torch Crosses Campus
events.description: The 1996 Olympic torch crosses the Texas A&M campus.

events.title: Baylor Dentistry and ETSU Join System
events.description: The Baylor College of Dentistry and East Texas State University merge into the Texas A&M University System. East Texas State University campuses are renamed Texas A&M University-Commerce and Texas A&M University-Texarkana.

events.title: First Big 12 Football Season
events.description: Texas A&M competes in its first football season in the Big 12 Conference.

events.title: Bush School Opens
events.description: The George Bush School of Government and Public Service opens.

events.title: Bush Library Complex Dedicated
events.description: The George Bush Presidential Library Complex is dedicated.

events.title: Bonfire Collapse Tragedy
events.description: The Bonfire stack collapses, killing eleven students and one former student and injuring 27 students.

events.title: Vision 2020 Announced
events.description: The Vision 2020 Task Force reveals plans to place Texas A&M in the Top 10 Public Academic Institutions by 2020.

events.title: Performance Studies Department Created
events.description: The Department of Performance Studies is established.

events.title: First Aggie Governor of Texas
events.description: Lt. Gov. James R. 'Rick' Perry '72 becomes the first Aggie to serve as Governor of Texas.

events.title: Silver Taps Monument and Muster Endowment
events.description: The Class of 1995 donates a Silver Taps monument and the establishes a $50,000 Muster Endowment Fund.

events.title: Turney Leonard's Ring Returned
events.description: Medal of Honor winner Turney W. Leornard '42's Aggie Ring is returned to A&M campus 56 years after being found on a European battlefield.

events.title: Reveille VII Becomes First Lady
events.description: Reveille VII becomes First Lady after Reveille VI retires.

events.title: First Aggie Chief of State
events.description: Jorge F. Quiroga Ramirez '81 becomes the President of Bolivia and the first Aggie to be named Chief of State.

events.title: Red, White, and Blue Out
events.description: After 9/11 occurred, Texas A&M students launch t-shirt sales to raise money for the families of New York police officers and firefighters. These t-shirts were worn at Kyle Field, turning the decks red, white, and blue.

events.title: AAU Membership Achieved
events.description: Texas A&M University becomes a member of the Association of American Universities.

events.title: World's First Cloned Cat
events.description: Texas A&M successfully creates the world's first cloned cat.

events.title: Robert Gates Named President
events.description: Robert Gates becomes Texas A&M's 22nd President.

events.title: Qatar Campus Opens
events.description: Texas A&M University opens a branch campus in Qatar.

events.title: Bonfire Memorial Dedicated
events.description: The Bonfire Memorial is dedicated. This memorial serves as a monument to remember those who lost their lives in the Bonfire collapse of 1999.

events.title: Six Animal Cloning Milestone
events.description: Texas A&M becomes the first academic institution to successfully clone six different animals.

events.title: Dr. Elsa Murano Named President
events.description: Dr. Elsa Murano is appointed President of Texas A&M University.

events.title: Reveille VIII Becomes First Lady
events.description: Reveille VIII takes over as First Lady after Reveille VII retires.

events.title: Dr. R. Bowen Loftin Named President
events.description: Dr. R. Bowen Loftin '71 becomes Texas A&M University's 24th President.

events.title: SEC Move Announced
events.description: Texas A&M announces its departure from the Big 12 Conference. Texas A&M officially joins the Southeastern Conference on July 1, 2012.

events.title: YMCA Building Reopens
events.description: The YMCA Building reopens after renovations.

events.title: Johnny Manziel Wins Heisman
events.description: Johnny Manziel wins the 2012 Heisman Trophy, becoming the first freshman to win this award.

events.title: Cotton Bowl Championship Victory
events.description: Texas A&M wins the Cotton Bowl Championship against University of Oklahoma.

events.title: Law School Joins System
events.description: The Texas Wesleyan Law School joins the Texas A&M University System. The school is renamed Texas A&M University Schol of Law.

events.title: Joint Library Facility Opens
events.description: The Joint Library Facility is opened at Texas A&M University's Riverside Campus. This library is shared by the Texas A&M University System and the University of Texas System.

events.title: Health Science Center Added
events.description: The Texas A&M Health Science Center is added as a unit of Texas A&M University.

events.title: Michael K. Young Named President
events.description: Michael K. Young is announced as the 25th president of Texas A&M.

events.title: Reveille IX Becomes First Lady
events.description: Reveille IX officially takes over as First Lady after Reveille VIII retires.

events.title: Riverside Campus Renamed RELLIS
events.description: Riverside Campus is renamed RELLIS campus. The acronym stands for Respect, Excellence, Leadership, Loyalty, Integrity, and Selfless Service.

events.title: Myles Garrett First Pick in NFL Draft
events.description: Myles Garrett is the first Texas A&M player drafted as first pick in the NFL draft.

events.title: Barbara Bush Laid to Rest
events.description: Barabara Bush, Former First Lady of the United States, is laid to rest at the Bush Presidential Library.

events.title: President George H.W. Bush Laid to Rest
events.description: President George W. Bush is laid to rest at the Bush Presidential Library.

events.title: Reveille X Becomes First Lady
events.description: Rev X is announced as First Lady following Reveille IX's retirement.

events.title: Katherine Banks Named President
events.description: Katherine Banks is appointed President of the University.

events.title: General Mark A. Welsh Named President
events.description: General Mark A. Welsh is appointed President of the University.
